p: Some infections, such as Trachoma, can be transmitted by multiple mechanisms, including direct contact with ocular or nasopharyngeal discharges, indirectly through contact with fomites (contaminated objects) from infected people, or through vector-borne mechanical transmission by flies (Heymann, 2008). Knowing how a disease is transmitted aids in understanding how to break the cycle of infection and control its spread. Table 2 displays selected infectious diseases and the recommended associated transmission precautions.
